premise: A crowd watching a dirt bike race
explanation_1: A crowd indicates that they are talking about people.

premise: Little boys are swimming with older men.
hypothesis: Boys and men are swimming together.

premise: man wearing a beret riding a bicycle
explanation_1: The man from sentence one is someone from sentence two.

premise: A woman is walking through a dark hallway out into an open street.
explanation_1: An open street is in the outdoors.

premise: People shopping as well as a man in the background who appears to be a business owner of the fruit stand.
hypothesis: They are at the local farmer's market.
explanation_1: The fruit stand might not be a local farmer's market.

premise: A boy trying to climb a wall.
hypothesis: The boy is trying to climb a wall with ledges on it.

premise: A boy in a green sweater is sitting at a table.
hypothesis: A boy wearing a green sweater is outside sitting at a picnic table.
explanation_1: Not all tables are a picnic table.
Just because this mother is holding her newborn infant it doesn't mean they are inside. They may be sitting in the backyard.

premise: 2 men are plowing a field together.
hypothesis: A mother and daughter go shopping.
explanation_1: 2 men cannot be a mother and daughter.  Also, one cannot be plowing a field and shopping simultaneously.

premise: A group of people taking photos of a train.
hypothesis: The group of people are at a restuarant in the back room.
explanation_1: People cannot be taking photos of a train and be at a restaurant in the back room simultaneously.

premise: A band is playing on stage with the guy on the left playing a red and white guitar.
explanation_1: playing and fishing are different actions

premise: A man wearing a beanie and blue jacket is standing near a wooden pole and squinting through the sunlight.
hypothesis: The man is on the beach staring at the moon.
explanation_1: when there is sunlight you could not see the moon
